comment: I made this with some frozen shrimp I picked up at Sam's Club, following the recipe exactly, and it turned out way too salty. I checked the bag the shrimp came in and found that there was salt already added to them! I tried again without salt and it turned out fine. Lesson learned: check the frozen shrimp for salt!
It worked really well. It was a great fast breakfast . I recommend adding extra cheese to bring you to flavor town!
The perfect, and simple sauce makes this dish. I enjoy it with some hot pepper flakes.
This is just like my Grandma used to make it. Needed to be cooked for about 10 minutes more than the recipe recommended. Make sure you adjust to your own equipment.
This was the bomb dot com! brought me straight to flavor town!
One of the best chicken parm recipes, for sure. I made this for my family, and it was a huge hit. I'm going to throw my old recipe away.
With this quick an easy recipe, you will never want to use Kraft mac n cheese ever again. The family loved this.
This is the only way I cook burgers now. Thin smashed burgers are far better, and easier than thick burgers that turn into meatballs.
This is my go to pasta recipe now. When you don't have a lot of time, you can't beat this.
This is such a quick an easy recipe. You can add any ingredients you wish to this recipe. I enjoy my eggs with ham, and bell peppers. I also use heavy cream to make it extra rich.
This recipe was great, but it needed some more salt. I also warmed up well for lunch the next day.
This was wonderful. The only bad part was there were no leftovers to try the next day!
These ribs fall off the bone!
